page.title: 03NW.SHERBORNE:WOODLANDS
page.content: Most of this area is cultivated farmland, there is little or no{common {land.}There are a number of small {wooded areas,}mostly on the north facing slopes of the hills. The largest of these stretches from Patson Hill to Holway Copse and is mostly {coniferous plantation.}The other areas, which are{mixed woodlands,}are Trent Wood, Rylands, Trent Barrow, Charlock Hill and Ratleigh Wood. These mixed woodland areas contain thick {undergrowth:}nettles, brambles, bracken, ferns, ivy and ground-elder. {Roe deer}can frequently be seen in the early mornings and evenings about these woods. There are also{rabbits,} {foxes, badgers}and many species of {woodland birds}and{butterflies.} {Buzzards}soar in the thermals above Charlock Hill, gliding for long periods without need for wing-beats.
